Arg.V:
#!/bin/bash
function updatepk() { if [ ! -z $1 ]; then if [ -e /var/run/yum.pid ];then exit 10 fi result=`yum -y update $1 2>&1` status=$? commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: command not found"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: No such file or directory"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk firewall-applet
exit 0

exit 0

exit 0

Vulnerability.Title: firewalld bug fix update
Vulnerability.Description:
Updated firewalld packages that fix one bug are now available for Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7. firewalld is a firewall service daemon that provides a dynamic customizable firewall with a D-Bus interface.
This update fixes the following bug:
* Previously, firewalld created the ifcfg backup file with the OLD extension when the ZONE setting of an interface with ifcfg was modified by the firewalld D-Bus interface or the command-line tools. As a consequence, the ZONE setting in the ifcfg file was set to a blank value by firewalld on reboot if NetworkManager and the network service were both enabled. With this update, firewalld creates the ifcfg backup file with the BAK extension, and the ZONE setting remains correct. (BZ#1410860)
Users of firewalld are advised to upgrade to these updated packages, which fix this bug.
Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
